SEARCH
Package edu.uw.pce.advjava.services

Interface PrivateMessageCodec

public interface PrivateMessageCodec
Interface for writing an encrypted byte array (ciphertext) and a signature of the plaintext data to file. Additionally, the shared key used to encrypt the order list will itself be encrypted for the recipient and included in as well.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    byte[]
    decipher(PrivateMessageTriple triple, String recipientKeyStoreName, char[] recipientKeyStorePasswd, String recipientKeyName, String signerCertFile)
    Decipher the provided message.
    PrivateMessageTriple
    encipher(byte[] plaintext, String senderKeyStoreName, char[] senderKeyStorePasswd, String senderKeyName, String recipientCertFile)
    Enciphers the provided date and populates the message.

  • Method Details

    • encipher

      PrivateMessageTriple encipher(byte[] plaintext, String senderKeyStoreName, char[] senderKeyStorePasswd, String senderKeyName, String recipientCertFile) throws GeneralSecurityException, IOException
      Enciphers the provided date and populates the message. Key stores will be accessed as resources, i.e. on the classpath.
      Parameters:
      plaintext - the data to be encrypted
      senderKeyStoreName - the name of the sender's key store resource
      senderKeyStorePasswd - the sender's key store password
      senderKeyName - the alias of the sender's private key
      recipientCertFile - the recipient's certificate file, as a resource path
      Returns:
      message containing the ciphertext, key and signature
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if any cryptographic operations fail
      IOException - if unable to write either of the files

    • decipher

      byte[] decipher(PrivateMessageTriple triple, String recipientKeyStoreName, char[] recipientKeyStorePasswd, String recipientKeyName, String signerCertFile) throws GeneralSecurityException, IOException
      Decipher the provided message. Keystores will be accessed as resources, i.e. on the classpath.
      Parameters:
      triple - the message containing the ciphertext, key and signature
      recipientKeyStoreName - the name of the recipient's key store resource
      recipientKeyStorePasswd - the recipient's key store password
      recipientKeyName - the alias of the recipient's private key
      signerCertFile - the signer's certificate file, as a resource path
      Returns:
      the plaintext from the file
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - if any cryptographic operations fail
      IOException - if unable to write either of the files
